sen.j: 小子部鉏鉤（ちいさこべのさひち、生年不詳 - 天武天皇元年（672年）7月または8月）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: CHISAKOBE no Sahichi (year of birth unknown - July or August, 672) is Japanese of Asuka period.
CHIISAKOBE no Sahichi (year of birth unknown - July or August, 672) was active in the Asuka period of Japan.
sen.cmt: 表記ミスがあります。用語を統一します。
sen.e: CHIISAKOBE no Sahichi (year of birth unknown - July or August, 672) was active in the Asuka period of Japan.

sen.j: 「鉏」は「金」偏で「且」をつくりとする字である。
sen.e: 鉏' is made up of the left-hand radical of a Chinese character '金' and the right-hand '且.'
sen.cmt: 漢字そのものが問題であると判断し、漢字も織り交ぜて訳出しました。
sen.e: 鉏,' one Chinese character of his name Sahichi (鉏鉤) is made up of the left-hand radical of a Chinese character '金' and the right-hand '且.'
鉏,' one Chinese character of his name Sahichi (鉏鉤) is made up of the left-hand radical of a Chinese character '金' and the right-hand '且.'

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「ちひさこべのさひち」。
sen.e: The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'CHIHISAKOBE no Sahichi.'
According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as Chifisakobe no Safichi.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥時代、は行は「ｆ」の音で発音されていたので「Chifisakobe no Safichi」となります。オリジナル著者がわざわざ「読み」の説明をしているのは現在と発音が違うからです。「旧仮名遣いでの」という説明はとても変てこで、この著者以外使わないでしょうが、無理やり正しく訳すと左のようになります。
sen.e: According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as Chifisakobe no Safichi.
Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき尾張国国司守として大海人皇子（天武天皇）に味方したが、内乱集結後に自殺した。
sen.e: Although he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) as a director general of Owari no kuni Kokushi (the provincial governor of Owari Province) in Jinshin War of 672, he committed suicide after the domestic conflict ended.
sen.cmt: 「尾張国国司守」の「守」について定訳不明のため、director generalと訳出しました。
sen.e: Although he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) as Owari no kuni no Kuni-no-mikotomochi-no-kami (the provincial governor of Owari Province) in the Jinshin War of 672, he committed suicide after the war had ended.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「国司守」は「くにのみこともちのかみ」。
sen.e: Although he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) as Owari no kuni no Kuni-no-mikotomochi-no-kami (the provincial governor of Owari Province) in the Jinshin War of 672, he committed suicide after the war had ended.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月24日に行動をおこした大海人皇子は、挙兵して吉野宮から伊勢国に入り、27日に美濃国に移った。
sen.e: Prince Oama, who took action on June 24, 672 the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac) raised the army and got into Ise Province from Yoshino no miya, and then moved Mino Province on 27th.

Prince Oama, who took action on June 24 of the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru, year 672) raised the army, left Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) and went to Ise Province, and then moved to Mino Province on 27th.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Prince Oama, who took action on June 24 of the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru, year 672) raised the army, left Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) and went to Ise Province, and then moved to Mino Province on 27th.

sen.j: その日、不破郡の郡家にさしかかったころに、尾張国司守小子部連鉏鉤が2万の衆を率いて加わった。
sen.e: When they reached Gunke (public office) in Fuwa Country on that day, a director general of Owari no kuni Kokushi, CHISAKOBE no Muraji no Sahichi joined with 20,000 people.
sen.cmt: 「尾張国司守」の「守」について定訳不明のため、director generalと訳出しました。
sen.e: Within the same day, when they reached the county office of Fuwa County, Owari no kuni no Kuni-no-mikotomochi-no-kami CHIISAKOBE no Muraji Sahichi joined the army of Prince Oama with 20,000 soldiers.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。訳語選択ミス、「衆」は「兵士」のことです。
sen.e: Within the same day, when they reached the county office of Fuwa County, Owari no kuni no Kuni-no-mikotomochi-no-kami CHIISAKOBE no Muraji Sahichi joined the army of Prince Oama with 20,000 soldiers.

sen.j: 大海人皇子は鉏鉤を誉め、その軍を分けて処々の道を塞いだ。
sen.e: Prince Oama praised Sahichi and divided the army to block the roads in places.
Prince Oama praised Sahichi and divided his army to guard the roads.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Prince Oama praised Sahichi and divided his army to guard the roads.

sen.j: わずかな時日で2万の兵力を動かしたことについて、後代の歴史学者は、5月に朝庭（朝廷）が山陵造営のためと称して美濃と尾張の人夫を動員し、武器を渡したこととの関係を指摘する。
sen.e: Regarding his moving of 20,000 people for a short period, historians of posterity point out the relation that Chotei Courtyard (Imperial Court) mobilized laborers of Mino and Owari Province on the pretext of an Imperial tomb's construction and gave weapons in May.

Regarding the reason he was capable of moving 20,000 soldiers within a few days, historians of posterity point out there was some relation to the fact that in May the Imperial Court had mobilized laborers of Mino and Owari Province on the pretext of construction of Imperial tomb and given them weapons.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Regarding the reason he was capable of moving 20,000 soldiers within a few days, historians of posterity point out there was some relation to the fact that in May the Imperial Court had mobilized laborers of Mino and Owari Province on the pretext of construction of Imperial tomb and given them weapons.

sen.j: 大海人皇子を討つために国司に用意させた兵力が、国司の判断で当の反乱に参加したとするのである。
sen.e: It is said that the force arranged by Kokushi to defeat Prince Oama took part in the rebellion by Kokushi's decision.

According to the opinion, although the Imperial Court had ordered the provincial governor (Sahichi) to arrange the force to defeat Prince Oama, the governor in question decided to support the Prince Oama's rebellion.
sen.cmt: 時制、文法、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: According to the opinion, although the Imperial Court had ordered the provincial governor (Sahichi) to arrange the force to defeat Prince Oama, the governor in question decided to support the Prince Oama's rebellion.

sen.j: 乱は大海人皇子の勝利におわり、8月25日に重罪とされた近江朝廷の重臣が処分された。
sen.e: The war ended with Prince Oama's victory and a senior vassal of Omi Imperial Court was punished for the serious crime on August 25.
The war ended with Prince Oama's victory and senior vassals of the Omi Imperial Court was punished for serious crimes on August 25.
The war ended with Prince Oama's victory and senior vassals of the Omi Imperial Court was punished for serious crimes on August 25.

sen.j: しかしこれより前に、鉏鉤は山に隠れて自殺した。
sen.e: Sahichi, however, had committed suicide secretly in a mountain before that.
Sahichi, however, had committed suicide secretly in a mountain before that.
Sahichi, however, had committed suicide secretly in a mountain before that.

sen.j: 大海人皇子は「鉏鉤は功ある者である。罪なくしてなぜ自殺したのか。これは陰謀があったのか」と言った。
sen.e: Prince Oama said 'Sahichi has the merits.
Prince Oama said 'Sahichi had produced achievements, I wonder why he committed suicide with no crime; was there a conspiracy?'
sen.cmt: オリジナルの括弧内文が分かれていましたので、ルールどおりに直します。
sen.e: Prince Oama said 'Sahichi had produced achievements, I wonder why he committed suicide with no crime; was there a conspiracy?'

sen.j: 鉏鉤は近江朝と通じていたのかもしれないが、真相は不明である。
sen.e: Although Sahichi might have a connection with the Omi Imperial Court, the truth is unknown.
